ygData.subject: Re: Another suggestion
ygData.msgSnippet: Shadow step, drill them with a DOT, a fear, some bow fire... Nay, dont take away shadow step. Morgul ... From: Wilson, ThomasX B
ygData.messageBody:
Shadow step, drill them with a DOT, a fear, some bow fire...
Nay, dont take away shadow step.

Morgul
----- Original Message -----
From: Wilson, ThomasX B <thomasx.b.wilson@...>
To: <shadowknight@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, September 17, 1999 3:10 PM
Subject: RE: [shadowknight] Another suggestion


> From: "Wilson, ThomasX B" <thomasx.b.wilson@...>
>
> Quick problem with walking around sucking the life out of things after a
> fight.. hehe do that in L. Guk and you'll won't have to worry about
waiting
> to heal as you will be coming back to your spawn point fairly quickly..
> (with full health I might add).
>
> Also considering that any lifetap we get would be so low in level it's not
> going to make a dent in my 1000+ hp's. At least with VE I don't have to
> worry about it, just cast it as the puller is incoming and let it do it's
> thing.
>
> Oh and Shadow Step is one of my most used spells in PVP. Really pisses off
> other melee classes if you keep bouncing around Dot'ing them (Plus a nice
> bow).
>
> Just give us a good old fashioned Armageddon spell that kills everything
in
> site and I'll be happy :)
>
> Thom
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Brian Hook [mailto:bhook@...]
> Sent: Friday, September 17, 1999 1:03 PM
> To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [shadowknight] Another suggestion
>
>
> From: "Brian Hook" <bhook@...>
>
> You are correct, the damage shields were far too powerful if put on a big
SK
> (ogre/troll). Your comments about Shadow Step are interesting.
>
> Lifetap/spike/draw would be used near the end of a melee in a group -- you
> could use it as a quick heal to minimize downtime.
>
> And personally, it has always been my idea that an SK feeds off the life
> force of the weak, so after a fight walking around and sucking the life
out
> of gnolls and orcs sounds very in character...
>
> Brian
>
>
